title: Marcos Alonso insists he didn't foul Hector Bellerin for Chelsea's opener against Arsenal
text:
Sport Marcos Alonso insists he didn't foul Hector Bellerin for Chelsea's opener against Arsenal The Gunners right-back was knocked out in the build-up to Chelsea's first goal in the Blues' 3-1 win at the weekend Share Alonso opened up on the challenge (Photo: Arsenal FC) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Chelsea defender Marcos Alonso has insisted his opening goal against Arsenal was not a foul, despite Hector Bellerin being KO’d. 
Alonso left Bellerin on the ground and needing to be substituted as he scored the first of his sides three goals at Stamford Bridge. 
Debate raged as to the goal’s validity have stood with many suggesting referee Martin Atkinson should have ruled it out. 
Alonso said, however: “I’m sorry for Bellerin but I didn’t foul him to score Chelsea’s first goal. The pair came together in the build-up for Chelsea's opener (Photo: IAN KINGTON/AFP/Getty Images) Hector Bellerin had to be substituted after the clash (Photo: AFP) Read More Bellerin 'recovering well at home' after being knocked out at Chelsea 
“I jumped a bit higher and got to the ball first, I didn’t even see him coming so I don’t think it’s a free-kick. 
“I feel sorry for him, he’s a good friend but I didn’t see him. I hope he’s okay.” 
Chelsea travel to Burnley on Saturday with Alonso targeting another chance to pile the pressure on the chasing pack. Alonso's goal put the Blues on course (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Chelsea's opening goal should "100 per cent" not have stood, claims Wenger 
He added: “We just need to go game by game. After this win the result in midweek is an even better point [away to Liverpool] so we’ll see what the other teams do and enjoy a couple of days off. 
“We are working had during the week and you can see that, we are giving everything on the pitch and getting results.” poll loading Can anyone catch Chelsea now? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
